edu.ncsu.csc216.airport_customs.simulation

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.airport_customs.simulation.Simulator

  • public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class oversees the whole entire simulation. This class sets up the ArrivalHall and the array of CustomsDesk. Also reports to the EventCalander for each step in the simulation.
    Author:
    Jesse Liddle - jaliddl2

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Simulator(int numCustomsDesks, int numPassengers)
      Constructor for the main simulation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulator

        public Simulator(int numCustomsDesks,
                 int numPassengers)
        Constructor for the main simulation. This gathers the number of passengers and the amount of customs desks to be used during this simulation run.
        Parameters:
        numPassengers - number of passengers to be simulated during the simulation.
        numCustomsDesks - number of customs desks to be used in this simulation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of customs desks is not between 3 and 17.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of passengers is not at least 1.

    • Method Detail

      • step

        public void step()
        Handles the next event for the EventCalendar.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Throws exception if program tries to take too many steps.

      • getStepsTaken

        public int getStepsTaken()
        Number of steps taken so far.
        Returns:
        stepTaken the number of steps the simulation has ran.

      • totalNumberOfSteps

        public int totalNumberOfSteps()
        Total number of steps the simulation will make.
        Returns:
        totalSteps the total amount of steps to be taken

      • moreSteps

        public boolean moreSteps()
        Checks to see if there are more steps to be made
        Returns:
        true if the simulation has not finished

      • getCurrentIndex

        public int getCurrentIndex()
        Index of customsDesk selected by the currentPassenger or -1 if null
        Returns:
        lineSelection the line that the current passenger is in

      • getCurrentPassengerColor

        public java.awt.Color getCurrentPassengerColor()
        Gets the color of the current passenger or null if there is no passenger. This method also catches null pointer exceptions.
        Returns:
        color color of current passenger

      • passengerClearedCustoms

        public boolean passengerClearedCustoms()
        Returns true if the most recent passenger has completed customs and left the line.
        Returns:
        True if the most recent passenger has completed customs and left the line.

      • averageWaitTime

        public double averageWaitTime()
        Average number of seconds the passengers spent waiting in a customs desk line prior to actually processing.
        Returns:
        averageWait the average for every passengers wait time

      • averageProcessTime

        public double averageProcessTime()
        Average number of seconds the passengers spent waiting to process.
        Returns:
        averageProcess the average for every passengers process time
